Adamson_, Mar 01 2008M^n * [1,0,0] = [a(n), A024495(n), A024494(n)], where M = a 3 X 3 matrix [1,1,0; 0,1,1; 1,0,1]. Sum of terms = 2^n. Example: M^5 * [1,0,0] = [11, 11, 10], sum = 2^5 = 32. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 13 2009Let M be any endomorphism on any vector space, such that M^3 = 1 (identity). Then (1+M)^n = a(n) + A024494(n)*M + A024495(n)*M^2. - _Stanislav Sykora_, Jun 10 2012Counts closed walks of length (n) at the vertices of a unidirectional triangle, containing a loop at each vertex. - _David Neil McGrath_, Sep 15 2014
